title: Drawing, "Design for a Soup Tureen (elevation)", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, green ink, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at upper right: 448
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: SOUPIERE/MILIEU DE TABLE; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/45.
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Bulbous body tapering at the bottom, the lower half decorated with seven applied bands. The rounded shoulder decorated with two applied bands, flanked by thin rectangular handles surmounted by ball decorations indicated in green ink. The circular lid comprised of a plinth, disc, and ball finial indicated in green ink. Underdrawing in graphite of tureen in golden section.
Plan of soup tureen is in the Puiforcat collection (195-164-35).
Puiforcat fabrication #: 448
